gameDetails.matchup: San Antonio Spurs @ Los Angeles Lakers

keyFactors.title: Lakers' Terrible Rebounding Defense
keyFactors.description: Lakers ranked 28th in defensive rebounding rate and 29th in offensive rebounding. Worst in the league at team rebounding.

keyFactors.title: No Elite Rim Protector
keyFactors.description: LeBron James OUT (sciatica - missing entire early season). Primary centers: Deandre Ayton, Rui Hachimura. No one to match Wembanyama's 7'4" frame.

keyFactors.title: Bounce-Back Spot
keyFactors.description: Coming off worst game of season vs Phoenix (9 points, 9 rebounds, 6 TO). Potential bounce-back narrative after embarrassing loss.

keyFactors.title: High-Pace Game
keyFactors.description: Game total set at 232.5 points. More possessions = more rebounding opportunities.

riskFactors: Phoenix game showed blueprint to limit him (double-teams)
Coming off worst game could indicate adjustment period

quarterBreakdown.description: Wembanyama picked up 2nd foul on offensive charge. Early foul trouble limited aggressiveness.
Played cautiously with 2 fouls. Lakers took lead by halftime 60-59.
CRITICAL: Picked up 4th foul just 40 seconds into 3rd quarter. Severely limited minutes and aggressiveness.
Picked up 5th foul midway through quarter. FOULED OUT at 1:39 remaining on offensive charge vs Rui Hachimura in 2-point game.

gameResults.whenMissed: Stuck at 8 rebounds when fouled out with 1:39 left. Needed 5 more in 1:39.
gameResults.gamePace: 234 total points (slightly over 232.5 total). High-pace as projected.
gameResults.foulTrouble: Catastrophic. 6 fouls, fouled out with 1:39 left in 2-point game. Three Spurs starters fouled out. Extremely whistle-heavy game (67 total fouls).

whatWentWrong.title: Foul Trouble (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentWrong.description: Fouled out with 1:39 remaining in 2-point game. Lost 1:39 of critical rebounding time (potential 2-3 rebounds). Forced to play passively in 2nd half with 4-5 fouls. Could not attack the glass aggressively.

whatWentWrong.title: Lakers' Rebounding Surge
whatWentWrong.description: Lakers dominated glass 57-46 despite being 28th in NBA. Deandre Ayton (10 rebounds) had strong game. Lakers had 12 offensive rebounds vs Spurs' 9. Uncharacteristic performance from Lakers.

whatWentWrong.title: Coming Off Bad Game
whatWentWrong.description: Phoenix game (9 rebounds) showed vulnerability. Second straight subpar rebounding performance (9, then 8). Possible mental/physical adjustment period rather than bounce-back.

whatWentWrong.title: Officiating Impact
whatWentWrong.description: 67 total fouls called (extremely high). Changed rhythm and flow of game. Limited Wembanyama's ability to play physical.

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Bottom 3rd percentile of season (2nd-worst rebounding game)

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Extreme outlier. 8 rebounds is 1.84 standard deviations below mean. Only ~3% probability in normal distribution. However, fouling out with 1:39 left is NOT normal variance - unpredictable circumstance derailed otherwise sound bet.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV (+6 cents). Got slightly better odds than closing market. Bet placed early captured value. Market agreed this was strong value (heavy OVER action).

keyTakeaways: Add historical foul-out rates to pre-game analysis (Wembanyama averages 2.8 fouls per game - low risk typically)
Game-to-game variance is high in opponent defensive metrics (Lakers dominated despite 28th ranking)
Bounce-back narrative may need 2-3 games to materialize after bad performance
Close games = more perimeter play late = fewer rebounding opportunities
This was a 'bad beat' - sound process, unlucky outcome due to unpredictable foul trouble
Would make this exact bet again 100 times and expect to profit long-term
verdict: Bad beat, not a bad bet. Process > results over small samples.
